statement.tex: %text Find the distance of the plane $3x-4y+12z=3$ from the origin. %

step.context: %text Perpendicular distance of point $P(x,y,z)$ from the plane $ax+by+cz-d=0$ is? %
step.reason:
%text The distance formula for perpendicular distance from a point $P(x_1, y_1, z_1)$ to a plane $ax+by+cz+d=0$ is given by, % \left\vert\dfrac{ax_1+by_1+cz_1-d}{\sqrt{a^2+b^2+c^2}}\right\vert \\
%text In the given problem, the perpendicular distance of the origin $(0,0,0)$ from $3x-4y+12z-3=0$ is given by, % \begin{align} d&=\left\vert\dfrac{-3}{\sqrt{3^2+4^2+12^2}}\right\vert =\left\vert\dfrac{-3}{169}\right\vert=\dfrac{3}{169} \end{align}
